newsitem.title: INDIA: ICRA RATES INDIA'S TANFAC NCD "LAA-".
newsitem.headline: ICRA RATES INDIA'S TANFAC NCD "LAA-".

text.p: Investment Information Credit Rating Agency of India Ltd (ICRA) said on Friday it has assigned an "LAA-" rating to the 100 million rupee non-convertible debenture (NCD) programme of Tanfac Industries Ltd.
ICRA said it has also assigned an "A1+" rating to Tanfac's 50 million rupee commercial paper programme.
ICRA said "LAA-" indicates high safety, and "A1+" highest safety.

Tanfac (TIL) is a joint venture set up by the Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corp (TIDCO) and the Aditya Birla Group. It is an integrated chemicals manufacturer, with market positions in aluminium fluoride and anhydrous hydrofluoric acid.
ICRA said that over the past two years, Tanfac's sales had been affected by the slowdown in the aluminium industry and the increase in the costs of fluorspar and sulphur.
"However, since 1996, there has been a revival in aluminium prices and a softening of raw material prices, leading to an improvement in TIL's net margins in 1996/97," it said.

The current issue of debentures is to finance in part a 300-million-rupee diversification project for the manufacture of organic chemicals used in making a family of bulk drugs known as fluoroquinolones, it said.
